title.narrative: Mekong Regional Water Governance Program – Inclusion Project Phase II

description.narrative: This investment builds on the Mekong Inclusion Project Phase I (2014/15-2019/20) currently being implemented by Oxfam Australia. It will be supporting civil society partners, women leaders and communities in Cambodia, Laos, Myanmar, Thailand and Vietnam and at the regional level, to engage with and influence governments, inter-governmental bodies and the private sector in water resource governance, planning and development. Using the tools and experience from IP1, IP2 will work more directly with private sectors, financiers and governments to enhance accountability in the hydropower sector but also broaden the activities to include community engagement in policy discussions on alternative energy sources. Furthermore, supporting CSOs, communities and women leaders in raising their awareness and strengthening their capacity to effectively engage with state and private sector actors contribute to Australia’s values in promoting open dialogue, prosperity and enhancing stability.
